content.data:
This Database stores all Machining Information required when processing 
 a Job from within Cabinetmaker.
The following is the breakdown of the tables and their fields:

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this   Cabinet/Assembly .

Cross-reference 
		 to [Jobs].[ID] linking the   Cabinet/Assembly 
 to 
		 a Job.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the Cabinet/Assembly.

A 
		 value representing the Height of the Cabinet/Assembly.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of the Cabinet/Assembly.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Rooms].[ID] linking the Cabinet/Assembly to a Room.

The 
		 Wall # the Assembly is located on.

The 
		 Class of the Cabinet/Assembly: 
 1 = Base 
 2 = Upper 
 3 = Tall 
 4 = Vanity 
 5 = Sink 
 6 = Split Level

The 
		 Type of the Cabinet/Assembly: 
 1 = Standard 
 2 = Corner 
 3 = Corner 45 
 4 = Corner 90 
 5 = Peninsula 
 6 = Lazy Susan 
 7 = Pantry 
 8 = End 
 9 = Blind Left 
 10 = Blind Right 
 11 = Filler

A 
		 user Comment for the Cabinet/Assembly.

content.data:
A 
		 unique number to reference this   Cabinet/Assembly .

Cross-reference 
		 to [Jobs].[ID] linking the   Cabinet/Assembly 
 to 
		 a Job.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the Cabinet/Assembly.

A 
		 value representing the Height of the Cabinet/Assembly.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of the Cabinet/Assembly.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Rooms].[ID] linking the Cabinet/Assembly to a Room.

The 
		 Wall # the Assembly is located on.

A 
		 user Comment for the Cabinet/Assembly.

rows:
A unique number to reference 
		 this Cut/Pattern.

Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

Cross-reference to [Materials].[ID] 
		 linking this Pattern to a Material.

Pattern 
		 number associated with a Material.

Order 
		 of the cut within a Pattern.

Cut 
		 record type: 
 N = New Pattern 
 C = Cut 
 P = Part 
 O = Offcut 
 W = Waste 
 G = Gap

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Cut 
		 is a Rip Cut as opposed to a Cross Cut (rip cuts run the length 
		 of the sheet, cross cut run across the sheet).

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Cut 
		 is a T-Cut.

Indicates 
		 the order in which Parts are produced.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the section being cut.

A 
		 value representing the Length of the section produced by the cut.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Part 
		 has been rotated W x L converse to sheets W x L.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Groups].[ID] linking a Part produced by the cut to a group: 
 0 = No Part

A 
		 value representing the X position of the Part relative to the 
		 sheet X axis.

A 
		 value representing the Y position of the Part relative to the 
		 sheet Y axis.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the Part.

content.data:
A unique number to reference 
		 this Cut/Pattern.

Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

Cross-reference to [Materials].[ID] 
		 linking this Pattern to a Material.

Pattern 
		 number associated with a Material.

Order 
		 of the cut within a Pattern.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Cut 
		 is a Rip Cut as opposed to a Cross Cut (rip cuts run the length 
		 of the sheet, cross cut run across the sheet).

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Cut 
		 is a T-Cut.

Indicates 
		 the order in which Parts are produced.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the section being cut.

A 
		 value representing the Length of the section produced by the cut.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Part 
		 has been rotated W x L converse to sheets W x L.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Groups].[ID] linking a Part produced by the cut to a group:

A 
		 value representing the X position of the Part relative to the 
		 sheet X axis.

A 
		 value representing the Y position of the Part relative to the 
		 sheet Y axis.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the Part.
This Table stores general information about this Database.

rows:
Internal 
		 database version counter used by update utility that adds fields 
		 and tables to the database

content.data:
Internal 
		 database version counter used by update utility that adds fields 
		 and tables to the database

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Drawing.

A 
		 value representing the Width of Operations.

A 
		 value representing the Length of Operations.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of Operations.

Shape 
		 in an ASCII comma delimited string: 
 Format: 
 (node count,x1,x2 ,radius1,flags1,.....xN,yN, 
		 radiusN,flagsN) 
 Flags: 
 0x08 = VTX_Radius 
 0x0400 = VTX_ArcLine 
 0x010000 = VTX_Visible

content.data:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Drawing.

A 
		 value representing the Width of Operations.

A 
		 value representing the Length of Operations.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of Operations.

Shape 
		 in an ASCII comma delimited string:
This table stores Edge Banding information for the Parts.

rows:
Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking the banding to a Part.

1 
		 based edge identifier from the part origin moving in a counter 
		 clockwise direction around the part.

Single 
		 character used to identify the banding in a label: 
 E = Exterior 
 I = Interior 
 D = Door

The 
		 Edge of the Part the banding is applied to: 
 Front 
 Back 
 Top 
 Bottom

content.data:
Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking the banding to a Part.

1 
		 based edge identifier from the part origin moving in a counter 
		 clockwise direction around the part.

Single 
		 character used to identify the banding in a label:

The 
		 Edge of the Part the banding is applied to:

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Group.

Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

A 
		 value representing the Number of parts in the group.

A 
		 value representing the Width of parts in the group.

A 
		 value representing the Length of parts in the group.

A 
		 value representing the Number of parts that may be over made for 
		 the group.

A 
		 value representing the Margin to be allowed around parts in the 
		 group for nesting.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Assemblies].[ID] linking the group to an assembly: 
 0 if not nesting per assembly

Links to ID field in Parts 
		 table when grain matching. Otherwise the value will be zero.

A boolean flag set true 
		 if these parts should ignore the material grain and be rotated.

		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

A 
		 value representing the Length of parts in the group.

A 
		 value representing the Number of parts that may be over made for 
		 the group.

A 
		 value representing the Margin to be allowed around parts in the 
		 group for nesting.

		 to [Assemblies].[ID] linking the group to an assembly:

		 table when grain matching. Otherwise the value will be zero.

		 if these parts should ignore the material grain and be rotated.
This table stores Job/Jobs from that make up the S2M Center Job.

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Job.

The 
		 Customer name as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer address as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer city as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer state as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer Zip as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer contact person as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer e-mail addressas specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer FAX numberas specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer phone number as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Customer mobile number as specified in the Job.

The 
		 Date of measuring the Job.

The 
		 Date of detailing the Job.

The 
		 Date of production for the Job.

The 
		 Date of delivery for the Job.

The 
		 Date of deposit acceptance for the Job.

The 
		 Date of installation for the Job.

The 
		 Date of final payment for the Job.

The 
		 Comments set on the Job.

The 
		 Data file the Job is saved in.

The 
		 programs build number that produced the data.

Company 
		 name on the security dongle.

Flag 
		 indicating what Product produced the Job: 
 1 = Solid 
 2 = Kitchen Builder 
 3 = CabnetWare Face Frame 
 4 = CabnetWare 32mm

A boolean flag set true 
		 if these parts should ignore the material grain and be rotated.

A boolean flag set true 
		 if these parts should ignore the material grain and be rotated.
This table stores all the Materials in the S2M Center Job.

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Material.

Material 
		 identifier. Combines [SourceDB] and [SourceDBID], using bit(24 
		 + SourceDB) as a source flag.

The 
		 source of the Material: 
 0 = Unknown 
 1 = Solid 
 2 = Kitchen Builder 
 3 = Cabnetware Face Frame 
 4 = Cabnetware 32mm

The 
		 source application's DBID for the Material.

A 
		 value representing the Quantity available of the Material.

A 
		 value representing the Width for this sheet of Material.

A 
		 value representing the Length for this sheet of Material.

A 
		 value representing the Thickness for this sheet of Material.

The 
		 Materials Type: 
 0 = Panel Stock 
 1 = Board Stock 
 2 = Laminate 
 3 = Banding 
 4 = Hinges 
 5 = Guides 
 6 = Pulls 
 7 = Miscellaneous 
 8 = Tops 
 9 = Molding

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 Material can be used in a Panel optimization.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   this 
		 Material originated from an Offcut Bin.

Material 
		 represents a sub-sheet when grain matching block exceeds saw phase 
		 limitations.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Material 
		 has Grain.

A 
		 value representing the Price associated with this sheet of Material.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if this   Material 
		 is face dependent (single sided).

Cross-reference 
		 to [MachineOverrides].[MatDBID] linking a Material to overrides 
		 of the default parameters.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   it 
		 is better to cut this Material with a climb or conventional cut.

A value representing the 
		 Percent of optimum Tool Feed Rate to use with this Material.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 System needs to select a tool for operations that minimize chipping 
		 on the front face. Assists in Selecting Up Shear / Down Shear 
		 router bit.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 System needs to select a tool for operations that minimize chipping 
		 on the back face. Assists in Selecting Up Shear / Down Shear router 
		 bit.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Tools].[ID] linking the outline tool to use if this Material 
		 is face up.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Tools].[ID] linking the outline tool to use if this Material 
		 is face down.

Minimum width to be considered 
		 offcut rather than scrap

Minimum length to be considered 
		 offcut rather than scrap

The smaller of the two amounts 
		 (material & tool) will be used for the path

This table stores all the Operations for the S2M Center Job.

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Operation.

Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

Cross-reference 
		 to [Cuts].[ID] linking the operation to a cut panel record for 
		 nested CNC routers.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking the operation to a part.

The 
		 Operation Type: 
 P = Part 
 O = Outline 
 D = Dado 
 B = Bore 
 R = Route 
 C = Cutout(pocket) 
 I = Island(pocket) 
 X = Edge Bore

The 
		 Operation Style: 
 0x01 = Pocket 
 0x02 = Inside 
 0x04 = Outside 
 0x08 = MDF Glass 
 0x10 = MDF Outline 
 0x20 = Preserve Dir

Cross-reference 
		 to [Tools].[ID] linking the operation to a tool.

The 
		 Face the operation will be milled from.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 operation and its geometry is flipped to be face up.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the operation (or part) width 
		 / diameter.

A 
		 value representing the Length of the operation (or part) length.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of the operation.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   Operation 
		 extends through the part.

A 
		 value representing the X component of direction vector for operation.

A 
		 value representing the Y component of direction vector for operation.

A 
		 value representing the Z component of direction vector for operation.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 Operation contains a closed shape path.

The 
		 Lead Type for the Operation: 
 0 = Tool Plunges In/Out 
 1 = Tool Ramps In/Out 
 2 = Tool Ramps In/Out leaving a Tab 
 3 = Tool Ramps In/Out leaving an Onion Skin 
 4 = Tool Ramps In/Out leaving an Onion Skin 
		 until all parts have been outlined and then returns to remove 
		 onion skins (Return Onion Skin).

Cross-reference 
		 to [PartOperations].[ID] linking the operation to a part operation.

Cross-reference 
		 to [PanelLayouts].[ID] linking the operation to a part on a sheet.

An 
		 Override to normal sort order of operations. Operations are 1st 
		 sorted by priority ascending.

Cross-Reference to [Toolsets.ID] 
		 if this operations was a result of a toolset

A 
		 unique number to reference this Operation.

Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

Cross-reference 
		 to [Cuts].[ID] linking the operation to a cut panel record for 
		 nested CNC routers.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking the operation to a part.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Tools].[ID] linking the operation to a tool.

The 
		 Face the operation will be milled from.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 operation and its geometry is flipped to be face up.

		 value representing the Width of the operation (or part) width 
		 / diameter.

A 
		 value representing the Length of the operation (or part) length.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of the operation.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   Operation 
		 extends through the part.

A 
		 value representing the X component of direction vector for operation.

A 
		 value representing the Y component of direction vector for operation.

A 
		 value representing the Z component of direction vector for operation.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 Operation contains a closed shape path.

The 
		 Lead Type for the Operation:
2 = Tool Ramps In/Out leaving a Tab
3 = Tool Ramps In/Out leaving an Onion Skin

4 = Tool Ramps In/Out leaving an Onion Skin 
		 until all parts have been outlined and then returns to remove 
		 onion skins (Return Onion Skin).

Cross-reference 
		 to [PartOperations].[ID] linking the operation to a part operation.

Cross-reference 
		 to [PanelLayouts].[ID] linking the operation to a part on a sheet.

An 
		 Override to normal sort order of operations. Operations are 1st 
		 sorted by priority ascending.

Cross-Reference to [Toolsets.ID] 
		 if this operations was a result of a toolset
This table stores the Panel Layouts.

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Panel Layout.

Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking a part to the parts table.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Materials].[ID] linking to the materials table.

The 
		 Pattern # the part is on.

The 
		 Index of the part on the pattern.

The 
		 Index of the pattern for repetitions (book).

Cross-reference 
		 to [Cuts].[ID] linking a part to the cut that produced the part.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Panel i s Face side up: 
 For a 1 sided Material the Sheet will be 
		 set so the most operations are up. 
 For a 2 sided Material the Parts will be 
		 flipped individually so that the most operations are up.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   a 
		 second program is required for the reverse face or edges - in 
		 other words any operations not covered by the face program.

Parts 
		 are numbered sequentially for this panel. Alpha character groups 
		 parts of same size.

content.data:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Panel Layout.

Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking this record to the RunInfo table

Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking a part to the parts table.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Materials].[ID] linking to the materials table.

The 
		 Pattern # the part is on.

The 
		 Index of the part on the pattern.

The 
		 Index of the pattern for repetitions (book).

Cross-reference 
		 to [Cuts].[ID] linking a part to the cut that produced the part.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Panel i s Face side up:

For a 1 sided Material the Sheet will be 
		 set so the most operations are up.

For a 2 sided Material the Parts will be 
		 flipped individually so that the most operations are up.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   a 
		 second program is required for the reverse face or edges - in 
		 other words any operations not covered by the face program.

Parts 
		 are numbered sequentially for this panel. Alpha character groups 
		 parts of same size.
This table stores the Part Operations.

rows:
Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking the operation to a part.

A 
		 unique number to reference this Part Operation.

The 
		 Operation Type: 
 1 = Dado 
 2 = Line Bore 
 3 = Cutout 
 4 = Route 
 9 = Hole

Cross-reference 
		 to [Tools].[ID] linking a tool to the operation. For automatic 
		 tool selection (recommended) the [ToolID] should be 0.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Length of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the X position of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Y position of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Z position of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the operation about the X axis.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the operation about the Y axis.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the operation about the Z axis.

A 
		 value representing the Repetition for Line Bores.

A 
		 value representing the Spacing for Line Bores.

Shape 
		 in an ASCII comma delimited string: 
 Format: 
 (node count,x1,x2 ,radius1,flags1,.....xN,yN, 
		 radiusN,flagsN) 
 Flags: 
 0x08 = VTX_Radius 
 0x0400 = VTX_ArcLine 
 0x010000 = VTX_Visible

Used 
		 to override normal operation sort. A positive group will allow 
		 an operation to be milled after the outline on a nest. A negative 
		 group will allow an operation to be milled prior to the outline 
		 on a part.

An 
		 Override to the normal sort order of operations. Operations are 
		 1st sorted by priority ascending.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Drawings].[ID] linking an extended AlphaCAM drawing with this 
		 operation.

A 
		 List   of System parameters associated 
		 with this operation.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Parts].[ID] linking the operation to a part.

A 
		 unique number to reference this Part Operation.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Tools].[ID] linking a tool to the operation. For automatic 
		 tool selection (recommended) the [ToolID] should be 0.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Length of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Depth of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the X position of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Y position of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Z position of the operation.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the operation about the X axis.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the operation about the Y axis.

A 
		 value representing the Rotation of the operation about the Z axis.

A 
		 value representing the Repetition for Line Bores.

A 
		 value representing the Spacing for Line Bores.

Shape 
		 in an ASCII comma delimited string:

Used 
		 to override normal operation sort. A positive group will allow 
		 an operation to be milled after the outline on a nest. A negative 
		 group will allow an operation to be milled prior to the outline 
		 on a part.

An 
		 Override to the normal sort order of operations. Operations are 
		 1st sorted by priority ascending.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Drawings].[ID] linking an extended AlphaCAM drawing with this 
		 operation.

A 
		 List   of System parameters associated 
		 with this operation.
This table stores the Parts Run Data.

rows:
Cross-Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking the record to a run record

Cross-Reference 
		 to [Parts.ID] linking the record to a part record

Output 
		 Type Flag: 
 0x01 = Selected 
 0x02 = Primary Machine 
 0x04 = Secondary Machine 
 0x08 = Drill and Dowel 
 0x10 = Too Big For Standard Sheet 
 0x20 = Too Big For Machine 
 0x40 = Too Big For Any Sheet

Cross-Reference 
		 to [Groups.ID] linking the part to a group

Program 
		 name for the part front face operations

Program 
		 name for the part back face operations

Face 
		 operation are in a mirrored work field

Back 
		 operation are in a mirrored work field

Bar 
		 code for horizontal machining on left edge

Bar 
		 code for horizontal machining on right edge

Bar 
		 code for horizontal machining on top edge

Bar 
		 code for horizontal machining on bottom edge

Binary 
		 graphic for this part used in reports

Margin 
		 around the part for nesting

Primary 
		 part edge that rest against the point-to-point pins (1=left, 2=top, 
		 3=right, 4=bottom)

Quantity 
		 of the part in this MachineSet Run

Part width as cut on machine. 
		 Extended size: which includes pre-mill + EDX & EDY

Part length as cut on machine. 
		 Extended size: which includes pre-mill + EDX & EDY

Indicates the Arrow Position, 
		 Arrow Flip and Face Up/Down flag. 
 
 The Flags are as follows: 
 0x01  Arrow Left 
 0x02  Arrow Right 
 0x04  Arrow Up 
 0x08  Arrow Down 
 0x10  Arrow Flip 
 0x20  Face Up 
 
 These values are repeated for each of the 
		 4 Edges: 
 
 The Left Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff 
 The Right Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00 
 The Top Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x010000  0xff0000 
 The Bottom Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x01000000  0xff000000 
 
 
 So a single field can store the Arrow orientation 
		 for all 4 Edges: 
 0x 12 01 18 21 
 0x 12 000000 
		 = Bottom Edge  Arrow Flip Right 
 0x00 01 0000 
		 = Top Edge  Arrow Left 
 0x0000 18 00 
		 = Right Edge  Flip Down 
 0x000000 21  
		 = Left Edge  Face Up  Arrow Left 
 
 The orientation flag is also used for the 
		 Front and Back program. The Bits have the same meaning with the 
		 exception that 
 
 The Front Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff 
 The Back Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00

Finished part width after 
		 banding. Size includes banding

Finished part length after 
		 banding. Size include banding

		 to [RunInfo.ID] linking the record to a run record

		 name for the part front face operations

		 Arrow Flip and Face Up/Down flag.

These values are repeated for each of the 
		 4 Edges:

The Left Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff 
 The Right Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00 
 The Top Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x010000  0xff0000 
 The Bottom Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x01000000  0xff000000

The Left Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff

The Left Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff

The Right Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00

The Right Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00

The Top Edge Uses the next 8 bits:

The Top Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x010000  0xff0000

The Bottom Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x01000000  0xff000000

The Bottom Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x01000000  0xff000000

So a single field can store the Arrow orientation 
		 for all 4 Edges:

0x000000 21  
		 = Left Edge  Face Up  Arrow Left

The orientation flag is also used for the 
		 Front and Back program. The Bits have the same meaning with the 
		 exception that

The Front Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff 
 The Back Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00

The Front Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff

The Front Edge Uses the first 8 bits: 
			 0x01  0xff

The Back Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00

The Back Edge Uses the next 8 bits: 
			 0x0100  0xff00

Finished part width after 
		 banding. Size includes banding

Finished part length after 
		 banding. Size include banding
This table stores the Parts for the S2M Center Job.

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Part.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Jobs].[ID] linking part to a job.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Part 
		 has been set for Optimization.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Part 
		 has been set for CNC output.

A 
		 value representing the Width of the part + EDX value without banding.

A 
		 value representing the Length of the part + EDY value without 
		 banding.

A 
		 value representing the Width displayed in output increment and 
		 precision.

A 
		 value representing the Length displayed in output increment and 
		 precision.

A 
		 value representing the Width of part without banding or EDX value.

A 
		 value representing the Length of part without banding or EDY value.

The 
		 user comment for the part.

A 
		 value representing the Quantity of the part.

A 
		 value representing the Quantity that may be over made for this 
		 part.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Rooms].[ID] linking the part to a room.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Assemblies].[ID] linking the part to an assembly.

A 
		 value representing the Primary part edge that rests against the 
		 point-to-point pins: 
 1 = Left 
 2 = Top 
 3 = Right 
 4 = Bottom

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   part 
		 should be output to a mirrored zone.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Part 
		 is shaped.

Shape 
		 in an ASCII comma delimited string: 
 Format: 
 (node count,x1,x2 ,radius1,flags1,.....xN,yN, 
		 radiusN,flagsN) 
 Flags: 
 0x08 = VTX_Radius 
 0x0400 = VTX_ArcLine 
 0x010000 = VTX_Visible

Cross-reference 
		 to [Tools].[ID] linking a tool to use for the outline of this 
		 part.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Part 
		 has Gang (Multi-Drill) Boring.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Part 
		 has horizontal boring.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this part to the machine used for primary 
		 output.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this part to the machine used for secondary 
		 output.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this part to the machine used for horizontal 
		 edge output.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this part to the machine used for cutting 
		 part from a strip.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this part to the preferred machine 
		 to use for primary output.

Reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this part to the preferred machine 
		 to use for secondary output.

A value representing the 
		 Margin around part for nesting.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   EdgeBanding 
 table 
		 contains data for this part.

Four 
		 character banding code (Width1, Length1, Width2, Length2) 
 0 = None 
 1 = Door Banding 
 2 = Exterior Banding 
 3 = Interior Banding 
 Plus the alternative Banding Characters.

Banding 
		 code format. 
 Edge types: (L)ength, (W)idth, (R)adius and 
		 (A)ngle 
 Banding types: e(X)terior and (I)nterior 
 Example:1L15I1R6X1A12X - 1 Length 15" 
		 long with Interior, 1 6" Radius with eXterior, 1 Angled edge 
		 12" long with eXterior

Solid 
		 edge banding flags from a parts origin related to part edge as 
		 follows: 
 (edges code_1....code_n) 
 Example: 6NNENEN 6 sided part from face clockwise 
		 stroke: 
 N = None 
 I = Interior 
 E = Exterior 
 D = Door

The 
		 Face finish ID form material database.

The 
		 Back finish ID form material database.

The 
		 Edge finish ID form material database.

A 
		 list of System parameters associated with this part.

A boolean value set true 
		 if this part is the finished composite part

Reference to [Parts.ID] 
		 linking this child part to the master composite part

This table stores the Part Work Flow with Machine Sets.

rows:
Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.Counter] linking the record to a run counter. The 
		 part workflow is per machine set

Reference 
		 to [Parts.ID] linking the record to a part record

A 
		 series of machine tags indicating the sequence and machines required 
		 to mill this part. Any machines listed in (M1/M2/M3) can 
		 be sent to any machine in the (list). 
 Examples: Saw-DnD(PP1/PP2) OR Saw-DnD-P2P 
		 OR Saw(DD1/DD2)(PP1/PP2)

content.data:
Reference 
		 to [RunInfo.Counter] linking the record to a run counter. The 
		 part workflow is per machine set

Reference 
		 to [Parts.ID] linking the record to a part record

A 
		 series of machine tags indicating the sequence and machines required 
		 to mill this part. Any machines listed in (M1/M2/M3) can 
		 be sent to any machine in the (list).

Examples: Saw-DnD(PP1/PP2) OR Saw-DnD-P2P 
		 OR Saw(DD1/DD2)(PP1/PP2)
This table stores the Rooms in the S2M Center Job.

rows:

		 to [Jobs].[ID] linking a room to a job.

A 
		 unique number to reference this Room.

Cross-reference 
		 to [Jobs].[ID] linking a room to a job.

A 
		 unique number to reference this Room.
This table stores the Run Information for the S2M Center Job.

rows:
A 
		 unique internal number to identify the machine output

Counter 
		 incremented each time output is created.

A 
		 3 character string to identify the Run: R01

Time 
		 stamp when output was created.

Reference 
		 to [Machines.ID] indicating what machine was used for output

A 
		 boolean value set true if output needs to be created for this 
		 machine

Directory 
		 selected for the output files

Label-IT 
		 file with data for this run

Current 
		 output is a geometric nest

A boolean flag set true 
		 if output occured with the Mill From Unfinished End When Possible 
		 was true

content.data:

		 unique internal number to identify the machine output

		 incremented each time output is created.

		 to [Machines.ID] indicating what machine was used for output

		 boolean value set true if output needs to be created for this 
		 machine

Directory 
		 selected for the output files

Label-IT 
		 file with data for this run

Current 
		 output is a geometric nest

A boolean flag set true 
		 if output occured with the Mill From Unfinished End When Possible 
		 was true
This table stores all the Shapes.

rows:
Cross-reference 
		 to [Operations].[ID] linking the shape to an operation.

The 
		 Shape element sequence within an operation.

The 
		 Shape Type: 
 OP = Open Poly line start 
 CP = Closed Polygon start 
 VT = Vertex 
 EP = Poly End 
 AB = Arc Begin 
 AC = Arc Center 
 AE = Arc End 
 CI = Circle

Tool 
		 compensation type: 
 N = None 
 L = Left 
 R = Right

A 
		 value representing the X position of this shape element.

A 
		 value representing the Y position of this shape element.

A 
		 value representing the Z position of this shape element.

A 
		 value representing the Radius of this shape element.

		 value representing the Z position of this shape element.

A 
		 value representing the Radius of this shape element.
